about.name: Sebastián Cruz
about.description:
I am a Computer Science and Civil Engineering student with a curiosity for turning ideas into useful software. I enjoy creating different kinds of projects and turning concepts into tangible solutions: automated scripts, bots, small APIs, and web prototypes. These days I’m exploring areas such as backend, data, cloud, and automation while strengthening my foundations in modeling, data structures, design patterns, testing, and version control. I like to start simple, iterate quickly, and measure results. I prioritize clear code, direct communication, and good practices. Right now, I’m building small end-to-end projects to learn by doing and to discover where I want to specialize. I’m looking for opportunities to collaborate or take on internships where I can contribute, receive feedback, and keep growing.
If you’d like to propose an idea, I’d be glad to talk with you.
about.window1Desc: Experience developing web applications with various frameworks
about.window2Desc: Scripts and CLIs to streamline repetitive tasks, webhooks/cron integrations, and lightweight bots that save times and minimize errors.
about.window3Desc: Containerization for reproducible environments, with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions) enabling automated testing, builds, and deployments.
